item.title: Aeolipile boiling: Your blog (with code and formula) on Steem!
item.description: Aeolipile: your code and formula on Steem Aeolipile update: new theme, link generator and more! These days I was busy tinkering with Aeolipile. Now it has more exciting features! Wanna know what is Aeolipile? See the posts above! Now we have author page! It has been at the checklist for a long time! A big fan of a Steemian? Here's a place for his/her any post at https://heyeshuang.github.io/aeolipile/#/@<USERNAME>! For example,

item.title: Aeolipile update: new theme, link generator and more!
item.description: A few days ago I introduced Aeolipile, a steem post reader designed for coders, providing some advanced features. And now, it becomes more powerful! As usual, you could see this post here. Link Generator You may wonder how did I get the post link before submit the post. The answer is: link generator. Just input your username and post title, and you'll have the Aeolipile Link(tm)! The generator uses the

item.title: 社交恐惧症患者也想用Steem，所以我做了Aeolipile
item.description: TL;DR: 你可以在这个链接看到Aeolipile。 我曾经说不会把博客完全搬到Steem上。除了之前说过的原因之外，还有一些感性上的理由。 和那些网红博

item.title: Aeolipile: your code and formula on Steem
item.description: https://heyeshuang.github.io/aeolipile/#/@heyeshuang/aeolipile-your-code-and-formula-on-steem Please click ↑ to read the post! Steem is a blockchain-based rewards platform for publishers to monetize content and grow community. However, the Steemit editor does not provide advanced markdown features, like code highlight, mathematical notation, etc. The lack makes it hard to write technical posts on Steem. So I made this webpage to render Steem discussion with more markdown syntax enabled. Then we can use Steem for some...boring

item.title: Auto-Switch IME in Vim-Mode-Plus for Atom Editor
item.description:
Update 2018-5: Now vim-mode-plus introduced new method to disable IME in the setting page. It’s time for this post to retire.

As a vim-user and Chinese-speaker, I prefer vim-mode-plus for Atom editor, but always disrupted by the IME in normal mode, like this:
